igcop 0.2.0
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Generating function for the IGL copula family

igl_gen.Rd

igl_gen is the function itself, and igl_gen_inv is its inverse; igl_gen_D is the derivative; and igl_gen_DD is the second derivative.

igl_gen(x, alpha)

igl_gen_D(x, alpha)

igl_gen_DD(x, alpha)

igl_gen_inv_algo(p, alpha, mxiter = 20, eps = 1e-12, bd = 5)

igl_gen_inv(p, alpha, mxiter = 20, eps = 1e-12, bd = 5)

Arguments

x

Vector of values >=0 to evaluate the function at, .
alpha

Parameter of the function, alpha > 0. Vectorized.
p

Vector of values to evaluate the inverse function at, between 0 and 1 (inclusive).
mxiter

Maximum number of iterations to run the Newton-Raphson algorithm when computing inverse. Positive integer, default 20.
eps

The Newton-Raphson algorithm for computing an inverse will stop if the step size is less than this small number.
bd

The largest acceptable step size in the Newton-Raphson algorithm. Step size is reduced if it reaches this large.

Details

Function arguments and parameters are vectorized, except for the algorithms (marked by _algo).

Examples

## Some examples of evaluating the functions.
arg <- c(0, 0.5, 3, Inf, NA)
#igl_gen(arg, alpha = 1)
#igl_gen_D(arg, alpha = 0.2)
#igl_gen_D(arg, alpha = 1)
#igl_gen_D(arg, alpha = 2)
#igl_gen_inv(c(0, 0.5, 1), alpha = 0.5)

## Visual
#foo <- function(u) igl_gen_inv(u, alpha = 0.5)
#curve(foo)
